head.title: Most Residents Optimistic About Their Financial Outlook

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Banking, Finance and Insurance

hedline.hl1: Most Residents Optimistic About Their Financial Outlook

abstract.p: Iona College Center for Social Research finds that 54 percent of Westchester County residents surveyed are optimistic about their financial future despite turbulent stock market (S)

block.p: Most Westchester residents are optimistic about their financial future despite turbulence in the stock market, according to a survey released last week by Iona College's Center for Social Research.

When asked, ''Do you think that one year from now you will be better off financially?'' 54 percent answered yes; 32 percent answered no; and 15 percent said they did not know. Men were more optimistic, with 62 percent answering yes, compared with 48 percent of women.
Most Westchester residents are optimistic about their financial future despite turbulence in the stock market, according to a survey released last week by Iona College's Center for Social Research.

When asked, ''Do you think that one year from now you will be better off financially?'' 54 percent answered yes; 32 percent answered no; and 15 percent said they did not know. Men were more optimistic, with 62 percent answering yes, compared with 48 percent of women.
The replies from Democrats and Republicans were about the same, with 54 percent and 56 percent, respectively, answering yes.
The survey was done in April and has a margin of error of plus or minus 4 percent.
